Key Match Events: Tyrese Haliburton and Pascal Siakam each scored 25 points to help Indiana Pacers get past the Golden State Warriors 108-96
Indiana took control with a 17-2 second quarter run that turned a 30-29 deficit into a 46-31 lead
The Pacers started slowly from 3-point range, but Haliburton and Bennedict Mathurin turned the game with back-to-back 3s in the middle of that big spurt that put Indiana in control
Pre-Game Insights: Golden State was led by former Pacers star Buddy Hield who had 17 points
Pat Spencer scored a season high 17 as the Warriors sat six players on their second game in two nights, including All-Star Stephen Curry, Draymond Green and Andrew Wiggins
Coach Steve Kerr said Green was bothered by a back injury and Curry had a bad knee
Post-Match Reflections: Indiana has won all five games by 10 or more points, Haliburton has rediscovered his All-Star level, and with the Pacers getting healthy, their depth is helping, too
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Pacers struggled to score in the paint in the first half, but finished the game with a 54-46 scoring advantage inside
